author: StevenTravelCaptainRogers

text: I own an aftermarket system called the Retro Duo made by Retro Bit that plays SNES and NES games. For some strange reason, certain NES games just have really crappy sound output with the system. (Such as Kirby's Adventure, Super Mario Bros. 3, etc...) This could possibly be a problem with the cartridges themselves, but I wanted to know if anyone thinks that this is a problem with the system. If anyone out there is having a similar problem to mine please let me know. It would be much appreciated. :)
author: Moop Bread

text: Also, I wanted to know if I should purchase an original NES system, and if that would fix the sound problem.
author: Moop Bread

text: +Moop Bread Sounds snippy, but try googling it. That's what I do whenever I get error messages or odd outputs. If you know anyone with an NES though, I'd definitely give it a shot. Isolate variables and go!
author: Joe Maxwell

text: @Joe Maxwell Wow this comment is old. XD I bought an NES ages ago and I'm having no sound issues at all! Lol.
